namespace traits
Summary
Variables
Integral_ConstantCompile time integral constant.
True_TypeBoolean (true) version of Integral_Constant.
False_TypeBoolean (false) version of Integral_Constant.
Is_IntegralVersion of <Bool_Type> for integral types.
Is_Floating_PointVersion of <Bool_Type> for floating point types.
Is_PointerVersion of <Bool_Type> for pointer types.
Is_PODVersion of Integral_Constant for POD types.
Is_EqualChecks whether two types are equal.

Is_EmptyChecks whether a given structure is empty.
Remove_ReferenceMakes non-reference type from type.
Remove_ReferenceSee above.
Remove_ReferenceSee above.

Variables

Integral_Constant

template<typename T, T v> struct Integral_Constant { static const T value = v; typedef T value_type; typedef Integral_Constant<T, v> type; }

Compile time integral constant.

True_Type

typedef Integral_Constant<bool, true> True_Type

Boolean (true) version of Integral_Constant.

False_Type

typedef Integral_Constant<bool, false> False_Type

Boolean (false) version of Integral_Constant.

Is_Integral

template<typename T> struct Is_Integral: False_Type {}

Version of <Bool_Type> for integral types.

Specializations

bool char unsigned char signed char short unsigned short int unsigned int long unsigned long

Is_Floating_Point

template<typename T> struct Is_Floating_Point: False_Type {}

Version of <Bool_Type> for floating point types.

Specializations

float double long double

Is_Pointer

template<typename T> struct Is_Pointer: False_Type {}

Version of <Bool_Type> for pointer types.

Only true specialization here is for T*.

Is_POD

template<typename T> struct Is_POD: Integral_Constant<bool, ( Is_Integral <T>::value || Is_Floating_Point<T>::value || Is_Pointer <T>::value )> {}

Version of Integral_Constant for POD types.  POD type is every integral, floating point or pointer type.  Non-POD types are defined, like various structs / classes.

Is_Equal

template<typename, typename> struct Is_Equal { enum { value = 0 }; }

Checks whether two types are equal.  This is a definition for the case when they are different, so its “value” is 0.

Is_Equal

template<typename T> struct Is_Equal<T, T> { enum { value = 1 }; }

Version for when they are equal, so the “value” is 1.

Is_Empty

template<typename T> struct Is_Empty: Integral_Constant<bool, Is_Empty_Impl<T>::value> {}

Checks whether a given structure is empty.  Version of Integral_Constant.

Remove_Reference

template<typename T> struct Remove_Reference { typedef T type; }

Makes non-reference type from type.  Get the non-reference type using the “type” member of this.

Remove_Reference

template<typename T> struct Remove_Reference<T&> { typedef T type; }

See above.

Remove_Reference

template<typename T> struct Remove_Reference<T&&> { typedef T type; }

See above.

namespace traits
template<typename T, T v> struct Integral_Constant { static const T value = v; typedef T value_type; typedef Integral_Constant<T, v> type; }
Compile time integral constant.
typedef Integral_Constant<bool, true> True_Type
Boolean (true) version of Integral_Constant.
typedef Integral_Constant<bool, false> False_Type
Boolean (false) version of Integral_Constant.
template<typename T> struct Is_Integral: False_Type {}
Version of Bool_Type for integral types.
template<typename T> struct Is_Floating_Point: False_Type {}
Version of Bool_Type for floating point types.
template<typename T> struct Is_Pointer: False_Type {}
Version of Bool_Type for pointer types.
template<typename T> struct Is_POD: Integral_Constant<bool, ( Is_Integral <T>::value || Is_Floating_Point<T>::value || Is_Pointer <T>::value )> {}
Version of Integral_Constant for POD types.
template<typename, typename> struct Is_Equal { enum { value = 0 }; }
Checks whether two types are equal.
template<typename T> struct Is_Empty: Integral_Constant<bool, Is_Empty_Impl<T>::value> {}
Checks whether a given structure is empty.
